name: Brown Rice Mung Bean Kitchari - Mung Bean Stew
description: Brown Rice Mung Bean Kitchari - Mung Bean Stew in an Instant Pot pressure cooker. Easy Khichdi. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Nut-free Indian Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup mung beans (dry whole green mung beans)
3.5 - 4 cups water (1/2 cup less for thicker)

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the beans and rice for atleast 15 minutes. Soak at this step as the next few steps take 15 to 20 minutes
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the beans and rice for atleast 15 minutes. Soak at this step as the next few steps take 15 to 20 minutes

recipeInstructions.text: Blend the onions, tomato, garlic, ginger, spices with a few tbsp of water to a smooth puree and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend the onions, tomato, garlic, ginger, spices with a few tbsp of water to a smooth puree and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Start the Instant Pot (IP) on saute at normal heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Start the Instant Pot (IP) on saute at normal heat.

recipeInstructions.text: When hot, add oil, let the oil heat up for a few seconds, then add cumin seeds. Roast the seeds for half a minute or until fragrant.
recipeInstructions.name: When hot, add oil, let the oil heat up for a few seconds, then add cumin seeds. Roast the seeds for half a minute or until fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the puree carefully, stir and cook until the puree thickens and smells roasted. 15 to 17 minutes. Switch the saute to off.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the puree carefully, stir and cook until the puree thickens and smells roasted. 15 to 17 minutes. Switch the saute to off.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the beans and rice and add to the IP. Add water, salt, lemon juice. Mix. Add chopped veggies if you like.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the beans and rice and add to the IP. Add water, salt, lemon juice. Mix. Add chopped veggies if you like.

recipeInstructions.text: Close the lid. Press Manual and adjust time for 10 minutes. (or pressure cook for 10 minutes after the pressure has released). * Brown Basmati Rice soaked for 15 minutes will cook in the 10 minute time. You might need to cook longer depending on the rice used (15 to 20 mins).
recipeInstructions.name: Close the lid. Press Manual and adjust time for 10 minutes. (or pressure cook for 10 minutes after the pressure has released). * Brown Basmati Rice soaked for 15 minutes will cook in the 10 minute time. You might need to cook longer depending on the rice used (15 to 20 mins).

recipeInstructions.text: The IP will start heating, and show "On" and then count down the minutes when the pressure has reached.
recipeInstructions.name: The IP will start heating, and show "On" and then count down the minutes when the pressure has reached.

recipeInstructions.text: Once done, let the pressure release naturally. Or if you are are in a hurry. Try the quick release after 5 to 7 minutes. * If the rice or beans are not cooked to preference, you can cook them on saute until they are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Once done, let the pressure release naturally. Or if you are are in a hurry. Try the quick release after 5 to 7 minutes. * If the rice or beans are not cooked to preference, you can cook them on saute until they are tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Taste and adjust salt and spice. Serve hot with crackers or toasted bread.
recipeInstructions.name: Taste and adjust salt and spice. Serve hot with crackers or toasted bread.
